Definition: In this task, you will be given a negotiation between two participants. You will need to answer 'Yes' if both participants agree to the deal, or 'No' if they do not agree to the deal.
Domains: Commonsense -> Concepts and Relations -> Social Commonsense

Positive Examples.input: THEM: i need the hats and the ball  YOU: i can give you one hat and the ball. i want 2 books and 1 hat  THEM: i have to have both hats and the ball or both hats and a book to make a deal  YOU: sorry, i won`t make a deal without a hat  THEM: if you take 1 hat i have to have everything else  YOU: sorry can`t do  THEM: no deal  YOU: yesh no deal, sorry  THEM: no deal  YOU: no deal.
Positive Examples.explanation: Both participants do not agree to the deal, so the answer is No.

Positive Examples.input: THEM: hi i would like the book and ball and you can have the hats  YOU: i can give you either the book or the ball  THEM: ill take the book  YOU: ok i will take the hats and ball  THEM: deal.
Positive Examples.explanation: Both participants agree to the deal, so the answer is Yes.

Negative Examples.input: THEM: lemme get that book and ball!  YOU: i need 2 balls and a hat  THEM: i'll take the book and two hats then?  YOU: ok.
Negative Examples.explanation: Both participants agree to the deal, so the correct answer is Yes.

Negative Examples.input: THEM: hello. i would like the book and one ball.  YOU: you can have one ball 1 hat  THEM: i need the book or it's no deal.  YOU: no deal i am keeping the book  THEM: ok no deal  YOU: okay sounds good  THEM: alright  YOU: okay  THEM: alright no deal  YOU: okay its no deal.
Negative Examples.explanation: Both participants do not agree to the deal, so the correct answer is No.

Instances.input: THEM: i would like the ball and one hat please  YOU: i need the ball, but you can have both hats if i get the books  THEM: i need the ball also. you can have everything else, if i can have the ball  YOU: i need the ball and at least one book to be worthwhile  THEM: i have to have the ball, or i can't make a deal  YOU: then we're at an impasse  THEM: yes i guess so  YOU: no deal  THEM: no deal  YOU: no deal.

THEM: ill take the hat and the books you can have the ball  YOU: i only like hats  THEM: too bad you can have the ball and 1 book  YOU: i can't read. i need the hat for the bad weather and i only have one leg so the ball is no good to me.  THEM: too bad i want the hat  YOU: fine take the hat i will take the rest,  THEM: no i want the hat and the books  YOU: nope  THEM: you can give me either the hat and 3 books or the hat 2 books and 1 ball  YOU: no you can have 2 books and the hat  THEM: okay deal  YOU: thanks.
THEM: i'll take the book. you can have the rest.  YOU: sounds good to me!
THEM: what about each of us getting 1 of each?  YOU: i'm a bookworm and hate sports. i will take the 2 books and give you all the outdoor stuff  THEM: sounds good to me.

THEM: i'll take 3 books, 1 hat, and the ball.  YOU: can't do that. i need the ball and either all books, or three books and a hat.  THEM: you can have 3 books and the hat. i need the ball.  YOU: i can't give up the ball, the ball is of highest value to me.  THEM: fine you can have the ball if i can have all the books and hats.  YOU: i can't do that either.  THEM: fine you can have the ball, 1 hat, and 1 book.  YOU: how about a ball, and either two hats and a book or two books and a hat?  THEM: no deal. you can have all the books if i take the hats and the ball.  YOU: i don't think we're going to make a deal today.  THEM: okay, so no deal was agreed?  YOU: no deal was agreed. sorry.

THEM: you keep all hats and i keep the rest  YOU: that will not work for mei need 1 book and 3 hats  THEM: ok so two hats and one book  YOU: i need 3 hats  THEM: ok fine  YOU: 3 hats and 1 book for me deal.
THEM: i just want the hat please  YOU: deal.
THEM: i would like 1 ball and 1 hat  YOU: nope, i need the hat ansd two books  THEM: i get the ball and 1 book. deal  YOU: deal.
